results.title: Stress and obesity signaling converge on CREB phosphorylation to promote pancreatic cancer.
results.text_hl: Here, we show that the stress mediator @CHEMICAL_Norepinephrine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009638 @@@norepinephrine@@@ and the beta adrenergic receptor agonist @CHEMICAL_Isoproterenol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007545 @@@isoproterenol@@@ rapidly stimulate @GENE_CREB1 @GENE_1385 @@@CREB@@@ phosphorylation at Ser133 in @SPECIES_9606 @@@human@@@ @<m>DISEASE_Carcinoma_Pancreatic_Ductal</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D021441 @@@PDAC@@@ cells. Exposure to the non-selective beta adrenergic receptor antagonist @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ or selective antagonists, including @CHEMICAL_Nebivolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068577 @@@nebivolol@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, or @CHEMICAL_ICI_118551 @CHEMICAL_MESH:C026777 @@@ICI118551@@@ blocked @GENE_CREB1 @GENE_1385 @@@CREB@@@ phosphorylation elicited by @CHEMICAL_Norepinephrine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009638 @@@norepinephrine@@@ or @CHEMICAL_Isoproterenol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007545 @@@isoproterenol@@@ in @<m>DISEASE_Carcinoma_Pancreatic_Ductal</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D021441 @@@PDAC@@@ cells.

citations.NLM: Sun X, Teper Y, Sinnet-Smith J, Markarian M, Hines OJ, Li G, Eibl G, Rozengurt E. Stress and obesity signaling converge on CREB phosphorylation to promote pancreatic cancer. Mol Cancer Res. 2024 Dec 6;():. PMID: 39642318
